summary: The 'Protecting Free Vaccines Act' mandates coverage for specific immunizations recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP). It requires various health plans, including Medicare, Medicaid, CHIP, and private insurance, to cover ACIP-recommended vaccines without cost-sharing. The bill specifies that this coverage applies to vaccines recommended as of October 25, 2024, and includes any updates to those vaccines. The bill has provisions regarding the dates of enactment and specific exceptions.
